# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

You can create the function `add_yearmonth` using the following Julia code, assuming you have the necessary packages installed:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df.ym = yearmonth.(df.dt)  # Extract year and month
    df.ym = convert.(Int, string.(df.ym))  # Convert to integer in "yyyymm" format
    return df
end
```

Make sure your DataFrame `df` has a column `dt` of type `DateTime`. The function will add the new column `ym` with the desired format.
